title: Period Nylons box display face?
content:
Hi all -

Trying to identify the beautiful PAUL'S script on this box reference - it was probably hand rendered I know, but hoping to identify a digital typeface to reinvent something similar...  
Any suggestions?  
Thanks!  
A.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141007091544im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Frenchnylon_4247.jpg)
author: anniemack

comments.content: Don't have the time right now for going through a complete identification process so I'm dropping here only names I like for alternatives: [Cantoni](http://web.archive.org/web/20141007091544/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/debi-sementelli/cantoni), [Magpie Paper Works](http://web.archive.org/web/20141007091544/http:/www.myfonts.com/foundry/Magpie_Paper_Works) (Dasha, Ondise, Saissant, Ahra)

Thanks Ryuk..... hmmm. They are all close, but too thin... Will have a cycle through myfonts period style brush scripts...  
Thanks for your suggestions!  
A.

If you want a look like this it’s usually best to hire a [lettering artist](http://web.archive.org/web/20141007091544/https:/pinboard.in/u:stewf/t:letterer/?sort=title), not modify a font. Many can do this, perhaps more affordably than you think.

Finally, did a complete round but came up with no match. Adding some more alternatives I've encounbtered with during the process: [Hollyhock](http://web.archive.org/web/20141007091544/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fonted-house/hollyhock), [Bombshell](http://web.archive.org/web/20141007091544/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/emily-lime/bombshell-pro), **[Sketch Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20141007091544/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/letters-numbers/sketch-script)**, [Anna Clara](http://web.archive.org/web/20141007091544/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/trial-by-cupcakes/anna-clara), **[Gemmadonati](http://web.archive.org/web/20141007091544/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/eurotypo/gemmadonati)**, [Asterism](http://web.archive.org/web/20141007091544/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/great-lakes-lettering/asterism) (more [Great Lakes Lettering](http://web.archive.org/web/20141007091544/http:/www.myfonts.com/foundry/Great_Lakes_Lettering)?), some [Adorn](http://web.archive.org/web/20141007091544/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/laura-worthington/adorn), [Santa's Pen](http://web.archive.org/web/20141007091544/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontforecast/santas-pen) (interesting lowercases), Eurotypo [Kumma](http://web.archive.org/web/20141007091544/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/eurotypo/kumma) and [Aleka](http://web.archive.org/web/20141007091544/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/eurotypo/aleka), [Madelinette](http://web.archive.org/web/20141007091544/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/tart-workshop/madelinette) (more [Tart Workshop](http://web.archive.org/web/20141007091544/http:/www.myfonts.com/foundry/Tart_Workshop)), [Emerson](http://web.archive.org/web/20141007091544/http:/typophile.com/wiki/https%3A/%252Fcreativemarket.com/OnTheSpotStudio/66765-Emerson), [Perron](http://web.archive.org/web/20141007091544/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontforecast/perron) No 2, [Garden](http://web.archive.org/web/20141007091544/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/los-andes/garden) Catchwords (interesting one even if it does not come as a keyable font)
